column4: Hi, I'm helping my friend to install ubuntu. She is not very good with computers and I'm not physically near her. She's not good at English so I'm not sure if I understand her well.

She is currently using Windows. I think she downloaded ubuntu and burnt it to a CD. She says that when she puts the CD in her drive she gets a question "if she wants to run by windows". I don't recognise that because I don't know what happens if you put a ubuntu CD in a drive while running Windows.
What is supposed to happen if you put a (newly burnt) ubuntu CD in the drive while running Windows?
It will just be mounted and displayed in a window
